title: Sona has the 4th highest winrate, best overall performance of supports and she got a lot of new toys

embed.description: LoL Statistics, Builds, Runes, Masteries, Skill Orders, Counters and Matchups for Sona when played Support. Statistics include Sona's Win Rate, Play Rate and Ban Rate. Counters include who Sona Support is Strong or Weak Against.

body:
Why do people want her buffed again?

Her play rate doubled, her win rate jumped up 2% and she is performing a lot better with the new masteries + items.

Why are people still demanding that she be buffed?

replies.body: People need to remember that shes sitting right in that 4th place because of the new itemization and masteries, not because shes a balanced champion, like vayne who got her items and bolts nerfed and shes still pretty fucking strong.

They may put HER in a balanced state, but masteries are already known for being exploited by certain champs like brand for maximus destruction, not to mention that now rageblade is becoming meta. They will nerf or change certain things, and as we can see, if Sona is just so dependant of what happens out of her base stats and spells then something is wrong.

Im not asking for buffs, Im just pointing out if a champ gets from (example) 20% winrate to a 50% from just one patch then riot team is doing something wrong.
There should be masteries/runes/items that should synergize with "X" champ, but making it straight viable from unviable (or viceversa) are two different things.
Before this patch I would have gone for Soraka or Nami, right now the best supp I can come up with is Soraka because the amount of health she can dish out is insane.
Thats what Im trying to say, rito its not adjusting her at all, thats why the new overhaul is making such a dramatic effect.

Riot has already showed everyone that they are not the kind who plans anything, they just overhaul the meta and players have to get used to it and trash previous meta every year for the sake of putting up with them.

you know what... just dont talk anymore. Saying they have no idea what they are doing is asinine and ignorant. If they didnt know what they are doing the game wouldnt work... period. Sona is never going to go back to her old state, so get over it already.

I can tell just from reading these few responses you dont have the slightest idea what balancing actually is and until you do you shouldnt make any sort of comments about it.
the only thing that worry me here is that they will nerf {{champion:63}}  rather than nerf the keystone

Sheep aren't interested in the "why."  People like the OP have a very strong hatred of Sona, see an opportunistic number to propagandize and immediately jump on it to make certain she continues to remain unplayable.

Read for yourself what he wrote in this thread:
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/ZIwweXqL-the-state-of-sona-mk-2?show=flat&page=10
...and judge for yourself what his intentions for making this one are.  Cause I can assure, it's not for her benefit.

Ok, but OP is saying there are still threads about this made.
95% sure everyone's still wrapped up in preseasoning salt.

OP's last sentence claims there are still threads made about sona needing buffs and demanding them. He isn't merely pointing out facts with that statement.

My point is that OP's last point is highly unlikely because of the salt.

They did not nerf her bolts.  They used to do 8% of the targets max hp as true damage at rank 5 now they do 12%.  Sure they removed the base damage, but they added a minimum damage so she only loses out with the new bolts for a tiny window of the game against squishies.  Yeah they nerfed BoRK, but high elo players just build Shiv/Firecannon on her instead.
To be honest, I think they need to make her ultimate feel a lot stronger, or at least make it more available. Right now it's a crappy Nami ult that doesn't slow.
The fact that Taric is number 3 in win rate among supports tells you something about using win rate to judge a character's strengthsâ€¦

Winrates alone are not a good indicator, true.

Winrates in combination with other data, as used for the overall performance on champion.gg, on the hand are rather indicative of a champion's performance.

Taric rose on patch 5.22 due to his strong anti-AD propensities, his anti-armor effects and his single-target CC becoming stronger (less Tenacity in the game). If team pick 4 ADs, who'd have guessed an anti-AD champion to become popular?
http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v636/pika310/LoL%20Meme%2059_zpsygxlkpzm.jpg

I'm guessing that one healing /shielding mastery works extremely well on her.

People don't necessarily want her buffed, they just want power shifted around so that she doesn't have to be gimped by crazy mana costs and  shitty base stats.

I have already stated that the preseason changes made her stronger, New FQC, both offensive and supportive options that she can spec into on masteries and do well with both, as well as Miss Fortune, Graves and Lucian being good now (3 ADC's who work very well with Sona)
A buff at this point would be idiotic

And this comes from that "Sona circlejerk guy who just wants her to be overpowered as fuck"
No reasonable person asks to buff Sona. Reasonable people ask for a real rework.

That was waaaayyy before the Preseason changes was even announced. Ever since she got that rework, people find her dull and boring to play. Her Q is decent if you have ability power runes, her W healing was very lackluster, her E is barely noticeable, and the only thing that was great was her ultimate. Her ultimate used to be 200 mana at rank 3, which is pretty ridiculous. 

When the new masteries and items appeared in the PBE for the Preseason, people speculated that anyone with healing or shields will be really good because of the Windspeaker's Blessing. Bard, Sona, Soraka, and Karma are doing very well in this patch.

I, as a Sona main for once, perfered the old Sona, but currently, the mana regen she has after FQC is unbelievably brutal. You never run out of mana, you have almost infinite heal and infinite sustain. I'm a guy who loves to spam abilities (huge URF player here), and with the increase of 5% cooldown cap, I personally reach that cap and it's satisfying.

People don't necessarily want her buffed. 

They want her changed, because as it stands right now she is often frustrating and mostly unsatisfying to play as, and obviously as there are people like tc who violently resist buffs, frustrating to play against.

Sona is historically an easy to use champion. That's a large reason why she's always had a high win rate despite little cc, large mana costs and as of the rework, a contradictory kit. Now, the itemization changes make it easier than ever to use her, and I myself, someone who rooted for Sona buffs, FINALLY enjoy post-rework Sona under the condition that I build 250% mana regen on her. (Not even joking) Just the spellthief's line alone is likely to bump up her win rate by a lot simply because it made her go from very easy to use to hard to use wrong.

We don't necessarily want Sona buffed. (At least not directly) We want her reworked to actually make sense. Her kit is frustratingly contradictory. Rapid Firecannon shouldn't make so much sense on Sona to make up for the range disparity between her Q and auto attacks- she needs to make use of this every time, because unlike the power chord of pre-rework, (where you could hold onto it until an opportune time to use it) the on-hit bonus is on a three second timer. If you don't land it, it's a nerf in comparison to pre-rework Sona. If you merely aim to land Q on two enemy champions every time, it's a straight nerf. She lost her aura for this after all.

Her heal has extremely low numbers in comparison to other champions and extremely high mana costs. It's double targetting somewhat makes up for this I guess, but what I really hate about her W is that 1. It gets stronger for hp missing and 2. it comes with a shield. And extremely short-lasting shield at that. Both of these are meant to be compensation for its low numbers, and both go against what Sona uses her heal for. She wants it as sustain. (Not necessarily as a combat move) Not being able to sustain means she can't discourage people to jump on her, which is her counterplay as an extremely squishy champion. I don't see how anyone would want a shield and % missing health bonus coupled with a damage and mana nerf in exchange for the defense aura she used to have, and I don't see how anyone would think the former is more cohesive in usage than the latter. To make use of the shield, you need to take damage, usually more than all that the shield can block AND all that the heal can heal.

I bypass this by grabbing {{item:1004}}{{item:1004}} after finishing {{item:2301}}, picking up {{item:3057}} for the passive and then finishing either {{item:3174}} or {{item:3165}}, usually the latter since there's less AP now and how everyone and their grandmother has lifesteal. Isn't it ridiculous that that much mana doesn't go to waste on her?

As for E... well...
http://i1239.photobucket.com/albums/ff517/ryik7/sad%20day_zps1jy4avab.png
#Sad Day

Now, combine all this with having to be right next to someone to give the full effect of your abilities. This doesn't make any sense. Do I want to hang back, or do I want to be up in the action? Is grouping up really to be encouraged? What niche does she even occupy? Nami with less cc and slightly lower cooldowns?
